events.message: The customer reported their vehicle was involved in a collision with another car at an intersection, resulting in rear bumper damage.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of the car collision and damage reported.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the client with the processing of the vehicle accident claim.
The client received an official acknowledgement email confirming the filing of their auto accident claim for their damaged car.
The insurance company requested a copy of the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimate from the customer.
Customer submitted the police report, multiple photos showing the accident damage, and an official repair quotation form.
The claims investigation team has begun reviewing the submitted documents and coordinating with repair shops regarding the accident.
All necessary investigations have been concluded verifying the cause of the collision and assessing the repair costs.
A settlement offer has been made to the customer covering the estimated repair costs and rental car expenses during repair.
The client responded positively to the proposed settlement and requested prompt payment to cover vehicle repairs.
The insurance claim was formally approved after the customer accepted all terms of the proposed settlement agreement.
Insurance payment was issued to the customer's designated account to cover all approved costs related to their car accident.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following confirmation that the customer received payment and repaired their vehicle.
All documentation and case files related to the car accident claim have been archived for future reference or audit purposes.
